a company.

Remember I told you at the beginning that

1257.37.text:
And you start to take a look at the spatial

1260.79.text:
They are not very similar until you get to

1266.26.text:
When we studied the jellyfish, what we found
was electrically and mechanically it behaves

1270.00.text: just like the heart, just like the heart.

1273.17.text:
So we took the jellyfish and we made a map
of where every cell was in the jellyfish.

1277.99.text:
And then we took a rat apart and we built
it cell by cell as a jellyfish.

1283.89.text:
So we took the stem cell technology I told

1287.92.text:
we took a map -- a template for the map of
where all the cells were in the jellyfish

1292.95.text: and we built it onto this polymer thin film.

1295.16.text:

1300.72.text: structure that looks very much like the jellyfish.

This is the jellyfish architecture, so we

We quantified it using fingerprint software

1390.60.text:
I am going to close, and I feel like I should

1393.87.text: here in keeping with the show here.

1397.42.text: But I want to say this about innovation.

1400.78.text:
First of all, innovators, I have never met
-- I'm not saying I am an innovator.

1404.23.text:
But the innovators I have got on my research
team are almost always angry about something.

1408.34.text: I have never met an innovator who's happy.

1409.99.text: I never met an innovator who feels helpless.

1414.17.text:
I have never met an innovator who didn't want
the freedom to operate.

1420.07.text:
And I never met an innovator who didn't work
much because that eureka moment to solve that

1424.57.text:
problem is going to come like a thief in the
night.

1426.71.text:
And if you are not working, if you are not
ready for it, you'll never get it.
